title: Edit and improve the History page

requirements.text: Update `frontend/src/pages/HistoryPage.tsx` to make the History page easier to navigate and maintain by refactoring the eight narrative sections (I–VIII) into a single structured data array and rendering the cards by mapping over that data, without changing the visible story text.
acceptanceCriteria: HistoryPage renders the same hero title/subtitle and the same eight sections (I–VIII) with the same visible wording as before.
The eight sections are defined in a single in-file data structure (e.g., an array of objects) and rendered via iteration (no repeated copy/paste Card blocks).
No console errors/warnings are introduced when visiting /history.

requirements.text: Add in-page navigation to `frontend/src/pages/HistoryPage.tsx` by including a table of contents near the top of the main content that links to each section (I–VIII) using anchored IDs, and ensure the anchor links work on both desktop and mobile.
acceptanceCriteria: A table of contents is visible on the History page and lists links for sections I through VIII using the section titles.
Clicking a table-of-contents link scrolls to the corresponding section card on the same page.
Each section card has a stable `id`/anchor target so direct URL fragments (e.g., `/history#section-iii`) scroll to the correct section.

constraints: Do not edit any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (compose existing UI components instead).

Do not modify Internet Identity hooks in immutable paths (`frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`).
Keep the backend as-is; no backend changes are required for this History page edit.
nonGoals: Adding admin/authenticated editing of History content with persistence.
Changing the site navigation structure or routes beyond improving the /history page content presentation.
